name: Angry Sardar Courtyard

reviews.review_text:
Located on the 18th June Road Panaji. This restaurant offers Indian menu and a lot of Punjabi touch to it. Menu has many options that you can choose from. Food items are overpriced.
Usually you may not find parking during the day hours as it is located on the busiest road of Panaji. Overall experience was good.

Lovely place for punjabi cuisine lovers. Manpreet Singh served with a spirit of excellence. Food portions are big, so beautiful careful while ordering. Patiala lassi is a must have. Paya soup was excellent. Aloo masala kulcha is quite filling. Mutton biryani is delicious. Crispy corn is tasty. Masala papad.

I had gone here with my family. It is a very family friendly place. The service is top class. All the servers are so well spoken and polite. They make you feel at home. The ambience is also amazing, everything is very colourful and aesthetic. Now coming to the food. The food wasn’t the best but it wasn’t the worst either. It was average. I feel it didn’t live up to the price. Specially the sardar chicken . I found it too dry and a little tasteless. The food is not exactly how you expect North Indian food to taste. But the service and the ambience makes it worth the visit.

description:
**Angry Sardar Courtyard: A Taste of Punjab in Panaji**

Nestled along the bustling 18th June Road in Panaji, Angry Sardar Courtyard has secured a commendable rating of 4.1 from over 2600 reviews, making it a popular choice for locals and tourists alike. This Punjabi-inspired restaurant specializes in North Indian cuisine, with an emphasis on hearty offerings like butter chicken—a favorite among 15 reviewers—and a variety of kebabs that have caught the attention of 10 patrons. The rich flavors and generous portions are ideal for anyone looking to indulge in traditional Indian comfort food.

**Ambiance & Design**

As you step into Angry Sardar Courtyard, you are greeted by a vibrant and colorful atmosphere that reflects the essence of Punjab. The décor is both lively and colorful, making it a family-friendly venue, as many reviews testify. Patrons have noted the aesthetic appeal of the interior, which is complemented by warm lighting that creates a welcoming environment. Pictures of the dining area reveal a cheerful space adorned with Punjabi-themed artwork and decorative elements that enhance the cultural dining experience. The restaurant's ambiance is not only inviting but also has a buzz that appeals to both families and groups of friends.

**Menu & Culinary Experience**

Angry Sardar Courtyard boasts an extensive menu that caters to a range of tastes, but their North Indian specialties seem to truly shine. Highlights include the beloved Patiala lassi, which customers rave about as a must-have refreshment. The Paya soup, with its rich flavors, has also been praised, while the mutton biryani has emerged as a standout dish for its deliciousness. However, some diners have expressed mixed feelings about certain offerings; for instance, specific dishes like the Sardar chicken have been described as average, with occasional notes on dryness. The presentation of food in the images showcases vibrant colors and ample portions, reinforcing the restaurant's generous servings.

For those with dietary preferences, there are a variety of vegetarian options available, with dishes like the aloo masala kulcha providing satisfying choices for meat-free diners.

**Customer Experience & Service**

Customer service at Angry Sardar Courtyard has received high marks, with numerous reviews highlighting the friendliness and attentiveness of the staff. Guests have connected with servers like Manpreet Singh, who provide service with enthusiasm and ensure a personal touch to the dining experience. Many feel at home in this welcoming environment, contributing to an overall positive experience despite occasional criticisms of food quality. The restaurant can be busy, particularly during peak hours, so patrons have noted that parking can be a challenge. However, the memorable service often outweighs these logistical inconveniences.

**Popularity & Reviews**

The sentiment surrounding Angry Sardar Courtyard is largely positive, with customers frequently highlighting the family-oriented atmosphere and the quality of service. While some diners have critiqued the value of specific dishes, the buzz on social media and the sheer volume of reviews reflects a loyal customer base eager to recommend it to others. Foodies seeking North Indian delight will find that this venue lives up to its reputation, bolstered by its growing presence in the local dining scene.

**Utilizing Visual Content**

The visual appeal of Angry Sardar Courtyard is apparent in customer-shared photos. The images display not only well-plated dishes like crispy corn and masala papad but also capture the colorful, lively atmosphere of the restaurant. From delightful lassis served in traditional glasses to inviting family-style table settings, these snapshots evoke excitement and make the dining experience at this establishment even more tempting.

In summary, Angry Sardar Courtyard stands out as a go-to destination for those craving authentic Punjabi flavors in the heart of Panaji. With a warm ambiance, attentive service, and a menu full of potential crowd-pleasers, it is well worth a visit for both local diners and visitors drawn to the charm of North Indian cuisine.
